title: India extends mandate for utilities to import 6% of coal needs until June
description: The Indian government has extended the mandate for power producers to import 6% of their coal requirements until June, due to transport constraints and higher electricity demand. Despite record production by state-run Coal India, imports are necessary because of constraints with the railway network. Peak power demand is expected to reach 250 GW in summer.
